item.title: More or less where indicated, 12th November
item.description:
Big pothole This has been reported before (possibly by me) because it has chalk marks around it. But it has now become a big pothole and in need of quick repair please. It is not the same as the two I reported the other day in line with front door of number 57 (Ref 8397712), which you have already told me will be inspected soon. I hope all three of these potholes can be re-inspected next week Many thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, London

item.title: Corrugated Roof Sheets - Asbestos Suspected, 12th November
item.description:
Several corrugated sheets have been dumped near the entrance to the park. I initially contacted Bexley Council, who washed their hands of the issue by not addressing it or responding to my emails. The Health and Safety Executive subsequently confirmed that the matter should be addressed by Greenwich Council. Given the nature of these materials, there is a strong possibility they contain asbestos, which poses a significant health risk if disturbed. I therefore kindly request that Greenwich Council arrange for the sheets to be safely removed as soon as possible, before they are damaged or shredded by the lawnmower, which could release harmful asbestos fibres into the air and endanger people, pets, and wildlife. Thank you for your prompt attention to this serious environmental and public health concern.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Camdale Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree outside property 154 Eldefield Road, 12th November
item.description:
This was reported on 17th June 2025 and was advised that trees are pruned every 3 years and next pruning is due this September. So far this tree has not been pruned and is overhanging property's 154 Elderfield Road. Please may I have a update

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Elderfield Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terrible litter, 12th November
item.description:
Gracefield Gardens is just off the centre of Streatham. Consequently lots of litter blows in off the High Road. It be also has huge footfall. However street cleaning has not been done for several weeks. Litter is now building up to awful levels and itâ€™s attracting more and more. Can the street cleaning please be done weekly like it is supposed to

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-8, Gracefield Gardens, Streatham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 26 Kenilworth Road NW6 7HJ, 12th November
item.description:
As reported earlier, in report no. 8257721 - the tree is causing damage and is overgrown. Cadent Gas has now had to dig up our front garden due to tree root damage to our gas supply! The tree roots are massive and coming under out house front wall. PLEASE POLLARD THE TREE URGENTLY!!!

item.title: Request for Tree Pruning and Pavement Safety Assessment, 12th November
item.description:
Dear Sir\Madam, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to request urgent attention to a tree located outside my property at 17 Teignmouth Road, Welling, Kent DA16 1LF. The tree has become significantly overgrown, and some of its branches appear dangerous, posing a potential risk to pedestrians and vehicles. Additionally, the tree roots have caused the pavement to bulge, creating an uneven surface. I have observed several people, particularly elderly pedestrians, trip over this area, which raises serious safety concerns. Could you please arrange for an inspection and pruning / removal of the tree, as well as an assessment of the pavement to ensure it is safe for public use? Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please find attached photographs as required. Kind regards, Jasvinder Chana

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Teignmouth Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
